title: Mark Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Mark chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Mark Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Mark Chapter 3.

questions.question: Who had a withered hand in the synagogue where Jesus entered?
options: A man
A woman
A child
A Pharisee
questions.correctAnswer: A man
questions.explanation: Mark 3:1 states that there was a man in the synagogue who had a withered hand.

questions.question: Why were they watching Jesus in the synagogue?
options: To see if he would heal on the sabbath
To listen to his teachings
To invite him to dinner
To follow him to the mountain
questions.correctAnswer: To see if he would heal on the sabbath
questions.explanation: Mark 3:2 says they watched him to see if he would heal on the sabbath day, so they might accuse him.

questions.question: What command did Jesus give to the man with the withered hand?
options: Stand forth
Sit down
Lay hands on your head
Follow me
questions.correctAnswer: Stand forth
questions.explanation: In Mark 3:3, Jesus says to the man with the withered hand, 'Stand forth.'

questions.question: What question did Jesus ask about the sabbath in relation to doing good or evil?
options: Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath, or to do evil?
Should we rest on the sabbath or work?
Is it lawful to fast on the sabbath?
Can the sabbath be changed?
questions.correctAnswer: Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath, or to do evil?
questions.explanation: Mark 3:4 records Jesus asking if it is lawful to do good or evil on the sabbath.

questions.question: How did Jesus respond when he saw the hardness of their hearts?
options: He looked around with anger and was grieved
He smiled and blessed them
He left the synagogue immediately
He preached a parable
questions.correctAnswer: He looked around with anger and was grieved
questions.explanation: Mark 3:5 shows Jesus looking around on them with anger, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts.

questions.question: Who took counsel with the Herodians to destroy Jesus?
options: The Pharisees
The disciples
The scribes
The multitudes
questions.correctAnswer: The Pharisees
questions.explanation: Mark 3:6 states that the Pharisees took counsel with the Herodians against Jesus.

questions.question: From which places did the great multitude come to Jesus?
options: Galilee, Judaea, Jerusalem, Idumaea, beyond Jordan, Tyre and Sidon
Rome, Egypt, Galilee, Samaria
Babylon, Galilee, Tyre, Sidon
Jerusalem, Damascus, Tyre, Sidon
questions.correctAnswer: Galilee, Judaea, Jerusalem, Idumaea, beyond Jordan, Tyre and Sidon
questions.explanation: Mark 3:7-8 list these places as origins of the great multitude that followed Jesus.

questions.question: Why did Jesus tell his disciples to have a small ship ready?
options: Because the multitude was pressing on him
To cross the sea quickly
To escape the Pharisees
To go fishing
questions.correctAnswer: Because the multitude was pressing on him
questions.explanation: Mark 3:9 explains Jesus told his disciples to have a small ship ready because of the multitude lest they throng him.

questions.question: What did unclean spirits do when they saw Jesus?
options: They fell down and cried, 'Thou art the Son of God'
They fled to the mountains
They ignored him
They caused confusion among the people
questions.correctAnswer: They fell down and cried, 'Thou art the Son of God'
questions.explanation: Mark 3:11 states that unclean spirits fell down before Jesus and declared him the Son of God.

questions.question: Who did Jesus ordain to be with him and to preach?
options: Twelve disciples
Seventy disciples
The Pharisees
The multitudes
questions.correctAnswer: Twelve disciples
questions.explanation: Mark 3:14 says Jesus ordained twelve that they should be with him and he might send them forth to preach.

questions.question: What surname did Jesus give to Simon?
options: Peter
Boanerges
Iscariot
Canaanite
questions.correctAnswer: Peter
questions.explanation: Mark 3:16 records that Jesus surnamed Simon as Peter.

questions.question: True or False: According to Mark 3:20, the multitude was so large that Jesus and his disciples could not eat bread.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 3:20 says the multitude came together so much that they could not so much as eat bread.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus’ own friends thought he was beside himself.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 3:21 states that when his friends heard of the crowd, they said he was beside himself.

questions.question: True or False: The scribes accused Jesus of casting out devils by the power of God.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 3:22 says the scribes accused Jesus of having Beelzebub and casting out devils by the prince of devils, not by God's power.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'No man can enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he will first ______ the strong man.'
options: bind
bless
fear
ignore
questions.correctAnswer: bind
questions.explanation: Mark 3:27 states that one must first bind the strong man before spoiling his house.

medium.title: Mark Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Mark Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with a hard heart and anger towards others. Based on Mark 3, how does Jesus demonstrate the appropriate response to hardness of heart?
options: He looks around with anger but also shows compassion and heals
He ignores them and walks away silently
He rebukes them harshly without healing
He prays for them privately but takes no action
questions.correctAnswer: He looks around with anger but also shows compassion and heals
questions.explanation: Mark 3:5 shows Jesus looking around on them with anger, being grieved for their hardness of heart, and then healing the man with the withered hand, demonstrating compassionate action even amid frustration.

questions.question: In Mark 3, Jesus appoints twelve disciples for specific purposes. What practical Christian virtue does this teach about leadership and service in the church?
options: Being chosen to serve others and preach with authority
Seeking power and personal gain
Isolating oneself from the community
Avoiding responsibility to escape criticism
questions.correctAnswer: Being chosen to serve others and preach with authority
questions.explanation: Mark 3:14-15 shows Jesus ordaining twelve to be with him, to preach, heal sicknesses, and cast out devils, teaching that Christian leadership involves active service and ministry for others.

questions.question: How does Mark 3:28-29 teach about the seriousness of forgiveness and blasphemy in Christian life?
options: All sins and blasphemies are forgiven except blasphemy against the Holy Ghost
Only sins against fellow humans are forgiven
All sins are forgiven without exception
Blasphemy is not a concern for forgiveness
questions.correctAnswer: All sins and blasphemies are forgiven except blasphemy against the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Verses 28-29 emphasize that while all sins and blasphemies are forgivable, blasphemy against the Holy Ghost is unforgivable, highlighting the need for reverence and humility in spiritual matters.

questions.question: A believer is feeling overwhelmed by many people pressing on them for help. What practical advice does Mark 3:9 offer about managing ministry and service?
options: Use practical means like a small ship to create space and order
Avoid helping people to reduce pressure
Only help those who are closest to you
Pray for fewer people to come
questions.correctAnswer: Use practical means like a small ship to create space and order
questions.explanation: Mark 3:9 shows Jesus instructing that a small ship should wait on him to prevent the crowd from thronging him, teaching that practical organization helps sustain ministry and service.

questions.question: What does Mark 3:4 teach about doing good and obeying God’s will, especially during times considered restrictive like the Sabbath?
options: Doing good and saving life is lawful and right even on the Sabbath
All work is forbidden on the Sabbath including helping others
Only religious leaders can decide what is lawful
No actions are allowed except prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Doing good and saving life is lawful and right even on the Sabbath
questions.explanation: Jesus questions whether it is lawful to do good or save life on the Sabbath (Mark 3:4), highlighting the principle that obedience to God's moral law includes mercy and kindness.

questions.question: A church member is concerned about accusations and gossip. How does Mark 3:22-26 instruct us to understand false accusations against God’s work?
options: Accusations against God's work are illogical because Satan would not oppose himself
All accusations should be accepted as truth
Ignore all accusations without explanation
Defend yourself by accusing others
questions.correctAnswer: Accusations against God's work are illogical because Satan would not oppose himself
questions.explanation: Jesus argues in Mark 3:23-26 that Satan cannot cast out Satan, and a kingdom divided against itself cannot stand, teaching that false accusations against God’s work are inherently flawed.

questions.question: According to Mark 3:31-35, how should believers prioritize spiritual family relationships over biological ties?
options: Those who do the will of God are considered Jesus’ true family
Only biological family members matter spiritually
Family ties are more important than obedience to God
Spiritual family is irrelevant to Christian life
questions.correctAnswer: Those who do the will of God are considered Jesus’ true family
questions.explanation: Verses 33-35 explain that Jesus defines his true family as those who do God’s will, teaching the priority of spiritual obedience over biological relations.

questions.question: True or False: In Mark 3, Jesus commands unclean spirits to reveal his identity openly to the crowds.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 3:12 states Jesus strictly charged unclean spirits not to make him known, indicating the importance of timing and discretion in revealing spiritual truths.

questions.question: True or False: Mark 3 shows that Jesus was accused of being possessed by an unclean spirit because of his miracles.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 3:22 and 30 record the scribes accusing Jesus of having Beelzebub and an unclean spirit, reflecting opposition to his ministry.

questions.question: A Christian leader must be strong to protect the church from evil influences. How does Mark 3:27 metaphorically illustrate this truth?
options: One must bind the strong man before spoiling his house
Always protect yourself by building walls
Ignore the enemy and hope for the best
Rely on worldly power to maintain control
questions.correctAnswer: One must bind the strong man before spoiling his house
questions.explanation: Mark 3:27 uses the analogy of binding a strong man to take his house’s goods, teaching that spiritual strength and authority are required to overcome evil influences.

questions.question: How does Mark 3:10 describe the faith and persistence of people seeking Jesus’ healing, and what practical lesson does it offer believers today?
options: They pressed upon him to touch him, showing determined faith
They waited patiently at a distance
They only came when invited
They doubted and stayed away
questions.correctAnswer: They pressed upon him to touch him, showing determined faith
questions.explanation: Verse 10 shows many pressing to touch Jesus for healing, modeling persistent faith that believers should emulate in prayer and seeking God’s help.

questions.question: Mark 3:6 reveals the reaction of the Pharisees after Jesus healed on the Sabbath. What does this teach about opposition to godly works and how Christians should respond?
options: Opposition may arise, but believers should remain faithful
Godly works will always be accepted without question
Avoid doing good to prevent opposition
Join in opposition to maintain peace
questions.correctAnswer: Opposition may arise, but believers should remain faithful
questions.explanation: Pharisees conspired to destroy Jesus after his healing (Mark 3:6), teaching that Christians can expect opposition but must continue in faithful service.

questions.question: What practical truth about faith and identity can be drawn from Jesus renaming Simon as Peter in Mark 3:16?
options: God gives new roles and identities based on faithfulness
Names have no spiritual significance
Only biological heritage matters
Titles are earned through worldly success
questions.correctAnswer: God gives new roles and identities based on faithfulness
questions.explanation: By renaming Simon 'Peter' (Mark 3:16), Jesus symbolically assigns a new identity, illustrating that faithfulness leads to spiritual transformation and calling.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Mark 3:35, 'For whosoever shall ___ the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.'
options: do
preach
follow
believe in
questions.correctAnswer: do
questions.explanation: Mark 3:35 directly states that those who 'do the will of God' are considered Jesus’ true family, emphasizing obedience as key to spiritual kinship.

questions.question: In Mark 3:20-21, Jesus’ family thinks He is 'beside himself.' What does this teach about the challenges believers may face from even close relations when pursuing God's will?
options: Believers may be misunderstood or opposed even by family in their spiritual walk
Family always agrees with spiritual decisions
Spiritual pursuits cause no conflict
One should avoid family to serve God
questions.correctAnswer: Believers may be misunderstood or opposed even by family in their spiritual walk
questions.explanation: Verses 20-21 describe Jesus’ family trying to seize him, thinking He is out of His mind, showing that following God can bring misunderstanding from loved ones.

hard.title: Mark Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Mark Chapter 3.

questions.question: In Mark 3, what is the significance of Jesus healing the man with the withered hand on the Sabbath, especially considering Jewish Sabbath laws and Jesus' teaching?
options: It demonstrates Jesus’ authority to interpret the Law and prioritize doing good over legalistic Sabbath rules
It shows Jesus breaking the law and inviting punishment
It was an act of defiance against the Pharisees to provoke a riot
It was an isolated miracle unrelated to Sabbath laws
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates Jesus’ authority to interpret the Law and prioritize doing good over legalistic Sabbath rules
questions.explanation: Mark 3:1-5 shows Jesus healing on the Sabbath and teaching that doing good and saving life is lawful, challenging rigid Sabbath interpretations.

questions.question: What is the literary device used in Jesus’ statement about a kingdom or house divided against itself in Mark 3:24-25?
options: Parallelism
Chiasm
Typology
Foreshadowing
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: Mark 3:24-25 uses parallelism by repeating the concept of division in a kingdom and a house to emphasize the impossibility of internal strife surviving.

questions.question: Who are the 'sons of thunder' mentioned in Mark 3:17, and what does this nickname reveal about their personalities or roles?
options: James and John, indicating their zealous and fiery nature
Peter and Andrew, indicating their leadership roles
Philip and Bartholomew, indicating their teaching style
Judas and Thomas, indicating their skepticism
questions.correctAnswer: James and John, indicating their zealous and fiery nature
questions.explanation: Mark 3:17 gives James and John the surname Boanerges, meaning 'sons of thunder,' reflecting their passionate, forceful personalities.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'he straitly charged them that they should not make him known' (Mark 3:12) reveal about Jesus’ ministry and Messianic secret motif?
options: Jesus wanted to control the timing of his Messianic revelation
Jesus was ashamed of his miracles
The disciples misunderstood his mission
The crowds already knew who he was
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus wanted to control the timing of his Messianic revelation
questions.explanation: Mark 3:12 shows Jesus instructing demons not to reveal his identity, consistent with the Messianic secret theme to avoid premature exposure.

questions.question: In the context of ancient Jewish legal debates, how does Jesus’ question in Mark 3:4 ('Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill?') function rhetorically?
options: It exposes the hardness of the Pharisees’ hearts and challenges their legalism
It confuses the audience with a paradox
It concedes that working on Sabbath is always wrong
It appeals to Roman legal standards
questions.correctAnswer: It exposes the hardness of the Pharisees’ hearts and challenges their legalism
questions.explanation: Mark 3:4 uses rhetorical questions to highlight the moral absurdity of forbidding good deeds on Sabbath, critiquing Pharisaic legalism.

questions.question: Which Old Testament concept is echoed in Mark 3:27 where Jesus speaks of binding the strong man before spoiling his house?
options: The idea of divine victory over chaos and evil (cf. Psalm 18:12-13)
The covenant with Abraham
The Exodus plagues
The Davidic kingship
questions.correctAnswer: The idea of divine victory over chaos and evil (cf. Psalm 18:12-13)
questions.explanation: Mark 3:27’s imagery of binding a strong man parallels Old Testament themes of God’s conquest over evil forces, such as in Psalm 18.

questions.question: How does the inclusion of Judas Iscariot among the twelve apostles in Mark 3:19 serve the narrative and theological purpose of Mark’s Gospel?
options: It foreshadows the betrayal and the unfolding passion narrative
It highlights Judas as the leader among the apostles
It shows Judas’ faithful loyalty
It indicates Judas’ role in preaching
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows the betrayal and the unfolding passion narrative
questions.explanation: Mark 3:19 introduces Judas Iscariot, setting up the future betrayal crucial to the passion story and Jesus’ mission.

questions.question: What is the cultural and historical significance of Jesus calling a small ship to wait on him because of the multitude in Mark 3:9?
options: It reflects practical concerns in overcrowded Galilean settings near the Sea of Galilee
It symbolizes Jesus' refuge from Roman soldiers
It represents a ritual purification practice
It indicates a nautical festival happening
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects practical concerns in overcrowded Galilean settings near the Sea of Galilee
questions.explanation: Mark 3:9 shows Jesus managing the large crowds by using a boat for space, illustrating the geographic and social context of Galilee.

questions.question: What theological theme is underscored by Jesus’ statement in Mark 3:35, 'For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother'?
options: The redefinition of family based on spiritual kinship rather than biological ties
The primacy of blood relations in salvation
The rejection of Jesus’ earthly family
The importance of ethnic identity
questions.correctAnswer: The redefinition of family based on spiritual kinship rather than biological ties
questions.explanation: Mark 3:35 emphasizes spiritual obedience as the true basis of belonging to Jesus’ family, transcending biological relationships.

questions.question: True or False: In Mark 3, Jesus explicitly states that blasphemy against the Holy Ghost will never be forgiven, highlighting the seriousness of this sin.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 3:29 explicitly states that blasphemy against the Holy Ghost has no forgiveness, underscoring its grave nature.

questions.question: Which groups conspired together to destroy Jesus after the healing on the Sabbath as described in Mark 3:6, and what does this alliance reveal about the political-religious dynamics?
options: The Pharisees and the Herodians, showing a rare alliance between religious conservatives and political collaborators
The Sadducees and the Romans, indicating a political conspiracy
The Essenes and the Zealots, revealing a revolutionary plot
The disciples and the scribes, showing internal Jewish conflict
questions.correctAnswer: The Pharisees and the Herodians, showing a rare alliance between religious conservatives and political collaborators
questions.explanation: Mark 3:6 describes the Pharisees and Herodians plotting together, highlighting tension between religious and political groups.

questions.question: What is the significance of the unclean spirits recognizing Jesus as 'the Son of God' in Mark 3:11, and how does this relate to Old Testament angelology and demonology?
options: It shows demonic acknowledgment of Jesus’ divine authority, consistent with spiritual realm awareness in OT texts
It indicates that demons were confused about Jesus’ identity
It proves Jesus was possessed by spirits
It contradicts Jewish monotheism
questions.correctAnswer: It shows demonic acknowledgment of Jesus’ divine authority, consistent with spiritual realm awareness in OT texts
questions.explanation: Mark 3:11 depicts demons recognizing Jesus’ divine status, aligning with OT views of spiritual beings aware of God’s messengers.

questions.question: How does Mark 3:22-26 use parable and analogy to refute the accusation that Jesus casts out demons by Beelzebub’s power?
options: By illustrating that Satan cannot cast out Satan without self-destruction, highlighting logical inconsistency
By admitting Jesus uses demonic power
By appealing to Roman law
By ignoring the accusation
questions.correctAnswer: By illustrating that Satan cannot cast out Satan without self-destruction, highlighting logical inconsistency
questions.explanation: Mark 3:23-26 uses parables about divided kingdoms and houses to logically discredit claims that Jesus acts by demonic power.

questions.question: How does the call of the twelve apostles in Mark 3:13-19 function as a typological link to the twelve tribes of Israel, and what is its significance in the narrative?
options: It symbolizes restoration and renewal of Israel through Jesus’ mission
It indicates a break from Jewish tradition
It was meant to replace the Pharisees
It foreshadows the destruction of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes restoration and renewal of Israel through Jesus’ mission
questions.explanation: Mark 3:13-19’s selection of twelve apostles echoes the twelve tribes, signifying a renewed covenant community under Jesus.

questions.question: What does Mark 3:21 reveal about Jesus’ family’s perception of him, and how does this tension contribute to the theme of misunderstanding in Mark’s Gospel?
options: They thought he was out of his mind, illustrating familial misunderstanding and social alienation
They fully supported his ministry
They wanted to make him king
They were indifferent to his actions
questions.correctAnswer: They thought he was out of his mind, illustrating familial misunderstanding and social alienation
questions.explanation: Mark 3:21 shows Jesus’ family attempting to restrain him, reflecting themes of misunderstanding and rejection in Mark’s narrative.

theological.title: Mark Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Mark Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What question did Jesus pose regarding the Sabbath in relation to doing good or evil?
options: Is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath days, or to do evil?
Is it lawful to rest on the Sabbath or to work?
Should the Sabbath be kept with strict rules or leniency?
Is it better to heal on the Sabbath or after it?
questions.correctAnswer: Is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath days, or to do evil?
questions.explanation: In Mark 3:4, Jesus challenges the Pharisees by asking if it is lawful to do good or evil on the Sabbath, highlighting the priority of mercy and restoration over ritualistic legalism. This reflects God's design for Sabbath rest to promote life and goodness (Exodus 20:8-11; Isaiah 58:13-14; Matthew 12:7; Hebrews 4:9-11).

questions.question: What was the condition of the man Jesus healed in the synagogue?
options: He had a withered hand
He was blind
He was deaf
He was paralyzed
questions.correctAnswer: He had a withered hand
questions.explanation: Mark 3:1 describes the man as having a withered hand, which Jesus healed, demonstrating His power over physical infirmities and His authority as the Messiah (Isaiah 35:5-6; Luke 6:6-10; Matthew 12:9-13; John 5:6-9).

questions.question: Why did the Pharisees watch Jesus closely in the synagogue?
options: To see if He would heal on the Sabbath and accuse Him
To learn His teachings
To invite Him to a feast
To ask Him questions about the Law
questions.correctAnswer: To see if He would heal on the Sabbath and accuse Him
questions.explanation: Mark 3:2 explains that the Pharisees watched Jesus to find a reason to accuse Him for healing on the Sabbath, revealing their legalistic mindset and opposition to Jesus’ ministry (Luke 6:7; Matthew 12:10; John 9:16; Romans 3:20).

questions.question: What was Jesus' emotional response to the hardness of the Pharisees’ hearts?
options: He looked around with anger and was grieved
He laughed at their ignorance
He ignored them
He was joyful for their faith
questions.correctAnswer: He looked around with anger and was grieved
questions.explanation: In Mark 3:5, Jesus is described as looking around with anger and grief over the hardness of their hearts, showing His righteous indignation toward sin and unbelief (Psalm 7:11; Ezekiel 36:26; Hebrews 3:12-13; John 11:33).

questions.question: Who took counsel with the Herodians against Jesus to destroy Him?
options: The Pharisees
The Sadducees
The disciples
The chief priests
questions.correctAnswer: The Pharisees
questions.explanation: Mark 3:6 states that the Pharisees went out and immediately took counsel with the Herodians to destroy Jesus, illustrating the growing opposition from religious and political groups against His redemptive mission (John 11:53; Matthew 26:3-4; Luke 22:2; Acts 4:1-3).

questions.question: What title did unclean spirits proclaim when they saw Jesus?
options: Thou art the Son of God
Thou art the King of Israel
Thou art the Prophet
Thou art the Son of Man
questions.correctAnswer: Thou art the Son of God
questions.explanation: Mark 3:11 records unclean spirits acknowledging Jesus as the Son of God, confirming His divine identity and authority over evil spirits (Psalm 2:7; Hebrews 1:5; John 10:36; Colossians 1:15-20).

questions.question: What instruction did Jesus give to the unclean spirits after they confessed Him?
options: He strictly charged them not to make Him known
He told them to spread the news
He commanded them to possess others
He ignored their confession
questions.correctAnswer: He strictly charged them not to make Him known
questions.explanation: Mark 3:12 states Jesus commanded the spirits not to reveal His identity, illustrating the Messianic secret motif to control the timing of revelation (Mark 1:34; Matthew 8:4; Luke 5:14; John 1:29).

questions.question: Who were the 'Sons of Thunder' that Jesus named?
options: James and John, sons of Zebedee
Peter and Andrew
Philip and Bartholomew
Thomas and Matthew
questions.correctAnswer: James and John, sons of Zebedee
questions.explanation: Mark 3:17 identifies James and John as the Sons of Thunder, highlighting their zealous and bold character, which underscores the dynamic nature of Jesus’ chosen apostles (Luke 9:54; Acts 3:1-8; Acts 4:13; Revelation 1:9).

questions.question: What power did Jesus give the twelve apostles when He ordained them?
options: Power to heal sicknesses and cast out devils
Power to build temples
Power to write scripture
Power to rule over Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Power to heal sicknesses and cast out devils
questions.explanation: Mark 3:15 describes the apostles’ empowerment to heal and cast out demons, affirming the continuation of Jesus’ healing ministry and authority over spiritual forces (Matthew 10:1; Luke 9:1-2; Acts 3:6-8; James 5:14-16).

questions.question: Who betrayed Jesus among the twelve apostles?
options: Judas Iscariot
Simon Peter
Thomas
Andrew
questions.correctAnswer: Judas Iscariot
questions.explanation: Mark 3:19 explicitly names Judas Iscariot as the betrayer, a fulfillment of Old Testament prophecy about the Messiah’s suffering and betrayal (Psalm 41:9; Zechariah 11:12-13; John 13:21-27; Acts 1:16-20).

questions.question: What accusation did the scribes from Jerusalem make against Jesus?
options: He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of devils casteth he out devils
He is a false prophet
He breaks the Law of Moses
He claims to be God
questions.correctAnswer: He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of devils casteth he out devils
questions.explanation: Mark 3:22 records the scribes accusing Jesus of casting out demons by Beelzebub’s power, a false charge that Jesus refutes with logical parables about Satan’s kingdom (Matthew 12:24; Luke 11:15; John 7:20; 1 John 4:1-3).

questions.question: What reason does Jesus give to refute the charge that He casts out demons by Satan's power?
options: How can Satan cast out Satan?
It is impossible to heal on the Sabbath
Demons have no power
He uses the Law of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: How can Satan cast out Satan?
questions.explanation: In Mark 3:23, Jesus uses the principle that a divided kingdom cannot stand to refute the accusation, emphasizing the unity and divine authority of His mission (Psalm 68:1; Isaiah 9:6-7; Romans 16:20; Ephesians 6:12).

questions.question: According to Jesus, what is the consequence of blaspheming against the Holy Ghost?
options: It hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation
It can be forgiven after repentance
It is less serious than other sins
It leads to temporary punishment only
questions.correctAnswer: It hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation
questions.explanation: Mark 3:29 warns that blasphemy against the Holy Spirit is unforgivable, emphasizing the seriousness of rejecting the Spirit’s work (Matthew 12:31-32; Hebrews 6:4-6; Luke 12:10; John 16:8-11).

questions.question: Who did Jesus identify as His true mother and brethren?
options: Whosoever shall do the will of God
His biological family only
His disciples who followed Him
The priests of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Whosoever shall do the will of God
questions.explanation: Mark 3:35 reveals Jesus’ teaching that spiritual kinship is based on obedience to God's will, redefining family in terms of faith and discipleship (Matthew 12:50; Galatians 6:10; Hebrews 2:11; Romans 8:14-17).

questions.question: What was the reaction of Jesus' family when they heard about the multitude surrounding Him?
options: They said He is beside Himself and went to lay hold on Him
They celebrated His success
They asked Him to rest
They invited Him home
questions.correctAnswer: They said He is beside Himself and went to lay hold on Him
questions.explanation: Mark 3:21 describes His family’s concern that Jesus was out of His mind due to the overwhelming crowds, indicating misunderstanding of His divine mission (John 7:3-5; Luke 8:19-21; Proverbs 3:5-6; Psalm 37:23).
